article.title: Search for dark matter and other new phenomena in events with an energetic jet and large missing transverse momentum using the ATLAS detector

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the primary process being depicted in Figure 1(a)?
choices: Pair-production of WIMPs via s-channel exchange of an axial-vector mediator
Pair-production of squarks via gluon fusion

multiple_choice_question.text: Which subfigures in Figure 1 illustrate possible production mechanisms for weakly interacting massive particles (χ) via a colored scalar mediator (η)?
What does the presence of a gluon in each subfigure of Figure 1 represent?
What is the decay mode of the squark (˜q) shown in Figure 1(e)?
What does the minimal width of the axial-vector mediator (Γ(mZA)min) depend on in this equation?
choices: Only the mass of the mediator (mZA)
Only the coupling constants (gχ and gq)
The masses of the WIMP (mχ) and the quark (mq), and the coupling constants (gχ and gq)
The masses of the WIMP (mχ) and the quark (mq), the coupling constants (gχ and gq), and the mass of the mediator (mZA)

multiple_choice_question.text: What does βf represent in this equation?
choices: The velocity of the fermion in the laboratory frame
The velocity of the fermion in the mediator rest frame
The decay width of the fermion
The coupling strength of the fermion to the mediator

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the Heaviside step function (θ(x)) ensure in this equation?
choices: That the mediator width is always positive
That the mediator decay only happens when kinematically allowed
That the coupling constants are properly normalized
That the velocity of the fermion is less than the speed of light

multiple_choice_question.text: In which scenario is the minimal width of the axial-vector mediator non-zero?
